marketNews.title: The Fed Remains Projected to Cut Interest Rates 3 Times in 2024
marketNews.content: The Fed decided to keep the policy interest rate in the range of 5.25-5.5% at the meeting on Wednesday (20 March) local time, in line with consensus expectations. In that meeting, Fed officials continued to project a total interest-rate cut of 75 basis points during 2024. This projection is unchanged from the forecast made in December 2023. Assuming each cut is 25 basis points, the Fed would cut rates three times in 2024. However, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the Fed will be more cautious because U.S. inflation data at the beginning of 2024 still exceeded consensus expectations. Powell also noted that the timing of rate cuts will depend on further economic data. On Thursday (21 March), the probability analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool showed that the market expects the Fed’s first rate cut to begin in June 2024, with a probability of 67.4%, up from 65.6% on 13 March 2024. Following the Fed announcement, the three major U.S. indices rose on Wednesday (20 March): the Dow Jones +1.03%, the S&P 500 +0.88%, and the Nasdaq +1.25%. Meanwhile, the U.S. dollar index (DXY) fell 0.18% to a level of 103.2. On the same day, the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury bond fell about 10 basis points to a level of 4.26%. Positive sentiment also appeared in gold, which strengthened by 1.2% to a price of $2,204.02 per ounce. Key Takeaway: Positive signals about potential Fed rate cuts open room for rate cuts by Bank Indonesia. However, uncertainty remains regarding the timing and magnitude of cuts. Rate cuts could act as a positive catalyst for several sectors, including banking, property, technology, and gold. On Thursday (21 March), the Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) rose 0.1%, with the finance sector up 0.45%, property up 1.11%, and technology up 0.91%.

marketNews.title: General Election Commission Declares Prabowo‑Gibran Winners of 2024 Presidential Election
marketNews.content: The General Election Commission (KPU) announced that the Prabowo Subianto‑Gibran Rakabuming Raka ticket won the 2024 presidential election, receiving almost 58.6% of the valid national votes. The inauguration is scheduled for 20 October 2024.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Reports Indonesian Bond Market Foreign Outflow
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian bond market experienced a foreign outflow of USD 1.1 billion since the presidential election voting on 14 February 2024. A strategist at Goldman Sachs, Danny Suwanapruti, said the trend was driven by investor concerns over potential fiscal easing by the new government, which promises a free‑lunch program during the campaign but has not detailed how the program will be financed.

marketNews.title: Swiss Central Bank Cuts Policy Rate
marketNews.content: The Swiss National Bank decided to cut its policy interest rate by 25 basis points to a level of 1.5%, contrary to consensus expectations that the rate would be held steady. This move marks the first central bank to loosen its monetary policy. The decision followed a reported inflation rate that fell to 1.2% in February 2023.

tickerNews.title: NCKL: Glencore and Itochu Identified as Potential Strategic Investors
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Glencore Plc. and Itochu Corporation are among the potential strategic investors for Trimegah Bangun Persada (ticker NCKL). Previously, NCKL shareholders on Friday (15 March) approved a rights issue plan amounting to IDR 18.93 billion (30%) of new shares. NCKL management said to Stockbit on Wednesday (28 February) that the company has three potential strategic investors: a European commodity company, an Asian company (outside China), and an Indonesian business group.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Reports February 2024 Komatsu Heavy Equipment Sales Decline
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (ticker UNTR) recorded sales of 307 Komatsu heavy‑equipment units in February 2024, a decline of 40.7% month‑on‑month and 43.8% year‑on‑year. In the first two months of 2024, Komatsu sales fell 33% year‑on‑year to 825 units, with market share also dropping to 30% (versus 34% in the same period of 2023). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR reported coal production volume of 20.5 million tonnes in the first two months of 2024, an increase of 19.2% year‑on‑year, with overburden removal of 183.8 million cubic metres, up 15.1% year‑on‑year.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Targets IDR 10 trillion Gold Jewelry Export in 2024
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi (ticker HRTA) CEO Sandra Sunanto said the company aims to export gold jewelry worth IDR 10 trillion in 2024, representing a growth of 132.5‑138% from the estimated 2023 export value of IDR 4.2‑4.3 trillion. HRTA plans to expand export markets to Singapore, Vietnam, the United States, and Europe. In 2023, HRTA exported only to India and the United Arab Emirates. Sandra noted that the company targets a net profit increase of 15% year‑on‑year in 2024, with revenue growth of 30% year‑on‑year. The company allocated IDR 60 billion of capex in 2024 to add 20 new stores, bringing the total store count to 103.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Reports 2023 Net Profit of IDR 2.78 trillion, Plans 2024 Land Sales Growth
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo (ticker AKRA) reported a net profit of IDR 2.78 trillion in 2023, a rise of 15.7% year‑on‑year, equal to 106.5% of consensus estimates. The result was supported by growth in the industrial property segment at JIIPE, which increased 103% year‑on‑year to IDR 2.32 trillion, while total revenue fell 11.5% year‑on‑year to IDR 42.1 trillion. The industrial property segment, which has higher margins than fuel trading and chemical distribution, helped lift the gross profit margin to 10.6% (up from 8.9% in 2022). In 2023, the segment sold 91 hectares of land, 121% of the 2023 target. In 4Q23, AKRA recorded a net profit of IDR 1.1 trillion, up 62% quarter‑on‑quarter and 28.9% year‑on‑year. For 2024, AKRA targets JIIPE land sales growth of 42.9% year‑on‑year to 130 hectares.

tickerNews.title: CNMA Announces 2023 Dividend of IDR 660 billion
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sejahtera Raya (ticker CNMA), the operator of the XXI cinema network, provided guidance that it will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2023 of IDR 660 billion, or approximately IDR 7.9 per share. This implies a dividend payout ratio of about 96%, higher than the prospectus guidance of IDR 35 per share. The plan will be discussed at the upcoming shareholders’ meeting. Based on CNMA’s closing price on Thursday (21 March) of IDR 222 per share, the implied dividend yield is roughly 3.5%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Sets 2024 Revenue Growth Target of 6‑10% YoY
tickerNews.content: Avia Avian (ticker AVIA) Head of Investor Relations Andreas Timothy Hadikrisno said the company targets revenue growth of 6‑10% year‑on‑year in 2024. The target will be supported by an increasingly complete product portfolio and an extensive distribution network. By the end of 2023, AVIA operated 118 own distribution centers, 14 mini distribution centers, and 40 third‑party distribution centers. In 2024, AVIA plans to allocate capex of IDR 450 billion for the construction of a plant with a capacity of 225,000 tonnes per year in Cirebon.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Shares Sold by PT Shima Global Kapital, Reducing Ownership to 13.91%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Energi Mega Persada (ticker ENRG), PT Shima Global Kapital, sold 45.75 million ENRG shares on 19 March 2024. The transaction is recorded only in KSEI data, so the sale price is not disclosed. After the transaction, PT Shima Global Kapital’s ownership in ENRG decreased from 14.10% to 13.91%.
